citations.narrative:
A large infestation of flies was observed in both the gestation and commercial rooms located on the north side of the
swine unit. Dozens of flies were observed in multiple pens and were observed to be present on hogs, feeders and pen
barriers in the rooms.
Flies can be a vector for transmission of animal diseases. Large numbers of flies may also cause undue stress and
discomfort to animals held in confinement. The facility needs to ensure that a safe and effective program for the control of
flies and other insect pests is established and maintained in all regulated animal housing areas.
Correct by 08-10-2024
The animal facility inspections were conducted with the NDSU IACUC and IBC Administrator, The NDSU Interim
Attending Veterinarian, The NDSU Farms Manager and the respective animal unit managers. The IACUC paperwork
inspection was conducted with the NDSU IACUC and IBC Administrator. The exit interview was conducted with the NDSU
IACUC and IBC Adminstrator, the NDSU Interim Attending Veterinarian, and the NDSU Farms Unit Manager.
n

narrative:
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
A large infestation of flies was observed in both the gestation and commercial rooms located on the north side of the 
swine unit. Dozens of flies were observed in multiple pens and were observed to be present on hogs, feeders and pen 
barriers in the rooms.  
 
Flies can be a vector for transmission of animal diseases. Large numbers of flies may also cause undue stress and 
discomfort to animals held in confinement. The facility needs to ensure that a safe and effective program for the control of 
flies and other insect pests is established and maintained in all regulated animal housing areas. 
 
Correct by 08-10-2024 
 
The animal facility inspections were conducted with the NDSU IACUC and IBC Administrator, The NDSU Interim 
Attending Veterinarian, The NDSU Farms Manager and the respective animal unit managers. The IACUC paperwork 
inspection was conducted with the NDSU IACUC and IBC Administrator. The exit interview was conducted with the NDSU 
IACUC and IBC Adminstrator, the NDSU Interim Attending Veterinarian, and the NDSU Farms Unit Manager.
